qas.question: When did Tajiks start being part of the Soviet Army?
How many Tajik troops fought against Germany, Finland and Japan during WWII?
What percent of Tajiks were killed during the war?
What was not developing as fast as other Soviet Republics?
Who began to be conscripted into the Soviet Army in 1929?
Tajik citizens fought against Germany, France, and what country?
Whose living conditions, education, and industry outpaced the other Soviet Republics?
Who had the highest household saving rate in the USSR?
By the late 1970s, Tajik nationalists were calling for what?

context: <b4_0>Tajiks<b4_0/> began to be conscripted into the Soviet Army in <a0_0>1939<a0_0/> and during World War II around <a1_0>260,000 Tajik<a1_0/> citizens fought against Germany, Finland and <b5_0>Japan<b5_0/>. <a2_0>Between 60,000(4%) and 120,000(8%)<a2_0/> of Tajikistan's 1,530,000 citizens were killed during World War II. Following the war and Stalin's reign attempts were made to further expand the agriculture and industry of Tajikistan. During 1957–58 Nikita Khrushchev's Virgin Lands Campaign focused attention on <b6_0>Tajikistan<b6_0/>, where <a3_0>living conditions, education and industry<a3_0/> lagged behind the other Soviet Republics. In the 1980s, <b7_0>Tajikistan<b7_0/> had the lowest household saving rate in the USSR, the lowest percentage of households in the two top per capita income groups, and the lowest rate of university graduates per 1000 people. By the late 1980s Tajik nationalists were calling for <b8_0>increased rights<b8_0/>. Real disturbances did not occur within the republic until 1990. The following year, the Soviet Union collapsed, and Tajikistan declared its independence.
